definition[0]: to do what needs to be done to complete something or make it successful
example[0]: The project went wrong when the staff failed to follow through.
example[1]: If you have followed through all the exercises in this book, you should be ready for the second year course.
definition[1]: to continue moving your arm after you have hit the ball in tennis, golf etc
definition[2]: the continued movement of your arm after you have hit the ball in tennis, golf etc
definition[3]: the things that someone does in order to complete a plan
example[2]: The budget has to cover not only the main project but the follow-through.
